document.docAuthor: Bakker, Piet A. J. & Albano, Paolo G.
document.masterDocTitle: Nomenclator, geographic and stratigraphic distribution of the family Triphoridae (Mollusca: Gastropoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Nomenclator, geographic and stratigraphic distribution of the family Triphoridae (Mollusca: Gastropoda)

bibRefCitation.author: Laseron, C. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Laseron, C. F. (1958) The family Triphoridae (Mollusca) from northern Australia; also Triphoridae from Christmas Island (Indian Ocean). Australian Journal of Marine and Freshwater Research, 9 (4), 569 - 658. https: // doi. org / 10.1071 / MF 9580569

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Australia , Port Curtis , 7–10 fathoms deep (
13–18 m
)
.

Type material.
AMS C.103059, holotype
.
AMS C.64118, paratypes
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Triphora ( Triphora ) pallida Pease, 1871
—
Ladd 1972: 45
, pl. 11, fig. 14.

Bouchetriphora pallidus ( Pease, 1871 )
—
Higo et al. 1999: 211
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
MCZ 50073
, lectotype
.
MCZ 288955 , paralectotypes
.

Remarks. The genus
Triphoris
is of feminine gender, therefore the name should be
Triphoris pallida
. Lectotype designation by Johnson (1994) . Kay (1979) and Marshall (1983) considered
Mesophora albomicra Laseron 1958 a
junior synonym of
Triphorus pallida Pease, 1871
. Marshall (1983) considered also
Triphora infelix Webster, 1906
,
Triphora angasi var. leuca Verco, 1909
,
Notosinister glacialus Laseron 1954
and
Notosinister candefactus Kosuge, 1963
junior synonyms of
Triphoris pallida Pease, 1871
.
